pageContent: Prostate cancer, the second leading cause of male deaths in the United States, has increased by 126% since 1987 (Stephenson, 1998). Early diagnosis is attributed to public awareness and technologic advances. Multiple options for definitive treatment with equally positive outcomes dramatically influence the patient's decision-making process. One popular option for these patients is transperineal implantation of radioactive seeds into the prostate.

metaData.source:
Knowledge and attitudes of men about prostate cancer
https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/18803533/
